problems.title: Sort First K Elements Using Bubble Sort
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an integer N, an integer K, and an array A of N integers. Your task is to sort only the first K elements of the array using the Bubble Sort algorithm. The remaining elements of the array must remain unchanged.
Bubble Sort compares adjacent elements and swaps them when they are in the wrong order. Perform sorting only on the first K positions of the array.

Input Format
The first line contains two integers N and K.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing the array A.

Output Format
Print the updated array after sorting only the first K elements.

Example 1
Input:
7 4
5 3 9 1 2 8 6

Output:
1 3 5 9 2 8 6

Explanation:
Only the first 4 elements {5, 3, 9, 1} are sorted → {1, 3, 5, 9}. The rest of the array remains unchanged.

hintsList: Perform bubble sort loops but only inside index range [0, k-1]
Do not touch remaining N-K elements
